intro: Conyza confusa, commonly known as the common blueweed, is an annual herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Americas. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has slender, branching stems covered with fine hairs. The plant produces small, white to pale blue flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom from late spring to early autumn. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and often have serrated edges. Conyza confusa is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in disturbed soils, making it a common weed in agricultural and roadside environments.
